get.summary: Search airports by country / Search nearby airports / Search an airport
get.description:
This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve a list of airports matching your search criterias.
The 3 mains search criterias are
- by country code, this will list all airports for a given country.
- by latitude/longitude with a radius in km. You can actually combine those 2 criterias, and search for example the closest airport in the USA of Vancoucer, Canada.
- The last way to use the API is by searching directly with a IATA CODE in the location parameter, this will only return one result in the array of data results

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: the language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The location you want to search for. Either a latitude/longitude point or a letter airport IATA CODE ( ex. LHR ) if you want the detail for only one single airport.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in km for a lat/long search, will be ignore if a IATA is passed in location parameter code is passed

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: Filter - The country ISO code 2 letters, provided by the GET /countries. If passed the results will be filtered to this country only, regardless if you passed a lat/long and a large radius

parameters.name: top_airports
parameters.description: Filter the results to only the top and large airports airports.

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Search all cities from lat/long or countrycode
get.description:
Search cities according to given criterias. Either lat/long + radius or country code. A limit can be given but cannot exceed 50 results.
A significant city will be defined according to the pourcent of population within a country.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: the language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: if you want to limit the result to one country

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The Lat/Long of the location your are seeking cities ( ex. 45.4478988,3.23456)

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in km for a lat/long search. Default is 20km and there is no maximum, but need to be combined with limit. code is passed

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit of the result. Default is 20 rows, and maximum is 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset of the result set

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order you want the result ordered. Default is population while when entering a lat/long, you can order the results by distance from requested lat/long point

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Retrieve cities informations from a string / build an autocomplete
get.description: Search cities from a string parameters.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: the string you want to search

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: the language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: if you want to limit the result to one country

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order you want the result ordered. Default is population while when entering a lat/long, you can order the results by distance from requested lat/long point

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Search significant cities from lat/long or countrycode
get.description:
Search cities according to given criterias. Either lat/long + radius or country code. A limit can be given but cannot exceed 50 results.
A significant city will be defined according to the pourcent of population within a country.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: the language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: pourcent
parameters.description: The pourcent of population the cities need to be in order to appear in results

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: if you want to limit the result to one country

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The Lat/Long of the location your are seeking cities ( ex. 45.4478988,3.23456)

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: Radius in km for a lat/long search. Default is 20km and there is no maximum, but need to be combined with limit. code is passed

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit of the result. Default is 20 rows, and maximum is 50.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: offset of the result set

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The order you want the result ordered. Default is population while when entering a lat/long, you can order the results by distance from requested lat/long point

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Search all continents or one specific continent
get.description: This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve all informations about continents

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: continentcode
parameters.description: The code of the continent you want to retrieve, this parameter is not required if you want ot retrieve all continents at once

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Search all countries or one specific country
get.description:
This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve a list of countries matching your search criterias.
The 2 mains ways to search use this API are
- by countrycode, it will only returns you one country
- without the countrycode parameter which will return the full list of countries

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: the language code of the language you want the content to be returned

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: The code of the country you want to retrieve

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.description: This webservice is providing you the ability to calculate the distance between 2 lat/long points, it returns you the value in km or miles

parameters.name: locationA
parameters.description: The location as a latitude / longitude point ( ex. 67.85572,20.22513 ) of location point A

parameters.name: locationB
parameters.description: The location as a latitude / longitude point ( ex. 67.85572,20.22513 ) of location point B

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit of length you want the elevation returned either meters or feet returned

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.description:
This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve the elevation in meters or feet of ONE or MULTIPLE given latitude/longitude point(s).
If you use MULTIPLE lat/long point, the maximum number of point you can send in one request is 256. Be aware that if MULTIPLE mode, the results are de-deplicated if you are sending the same latitude/longitude point multiple times.
If your workload is a batch of millions of lat/long point, You will also get better throughput if you send around 100 lat/long points in one request than the maximum. This maximum is mostly allowed for people trying to graph altitudes.

parameters.name: locations
parameters.description: The location as a latitude / longitude point ( ex. 67.85572,20.22513 ) or a list of coordinates separated using the pipe ('|') character. The maximum number of coordinates you can send at one time is 20 ( ex. 67.85572,20.22513|27.85572,20.22513 )

parameters.name: unit
parameters.description: The unit of length you want the elevation returned either meters or feet returned

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.description: Returns a ping. In case you need a health check in your system. Cannot be called /ping as AWS is using this route for their health check. This webservice doesn't have CORS enable, as it's supposed to be call server to server and not from a webpage ( it won't work over the tester)

get.summary: Search position of sun from lat/long and date
get.description: This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve the time of each phases of the sunlight cycle. Sunset, sunrise, sunriseEnd, golden hour, solarNoon, dawn, dusk and more for a given location and date. If the date if not provided, the response provided return informations for today at UTC time.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Here you can send either a latitude / longitude

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date for what you will get the data ( full-date notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21 ), if not provided as parameter, today is going to be used

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

get.summary: Search timezone and time informations from lat/long
get.description: This webservice is providing you the ability to retrieve the tz database time zones ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones )  from a given location ( )latitude and longitude or IATA code ). It also returns you the current time at the provided location.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Here you can send either a latitude / longitude ( ex. 67.85572,20.22513 ) or a IATA Code ( ex. LHR for London Heathrow)

options.description: Enable CORS by returning correct headers

AirportsSearchResponse.description: This section provides response schema of Airport Search Response

items.description: Here is a list of alternate name for the city in the requested language

asciiname.description: The ASCII name of the city

country.description: The 2 letter ISO code of the country the city belongs to

latitude.description: The latitude considered as central for the city

longitude.description: The longitude considered as central for the city

timezone.description: The longitude considered as central for the city

CitiesData.description: This is the data object for the response of a Cities APIs calls

CitiesResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a Cities API call

code.description: The ISO code of the continent.

items.description: Here is a list of country code that belong to the continent

latitude.description: The latitude considered as central for the continent

longitude.description: The longitude considered as central for the continent

name.description: The name of the continent in english

name_locale.description: The name of the continent in the requested languager

ContinentData.description: This is the data object for the response of a Continent API call

ContinentsResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a Continent API call

airportscount.description: The name of the country in english language

items.description: The other given name, nickname of the country, this is as well as in requested language but also foreign languages

areainsqkm.description: The superficy of the country in square km

capital.description: The capital of this country in english language

currencyname.description: The local name of the currency used in this country

fr_article.description: The name of the country in english language

fr_preposition.description: The name of the country in english language

iso_alpha2.description: The 2 letter ISO code of the country

languages.description: The name of the country in english language

latitude.description: The latitude considered as central for this country

longitude.description: The longitude considered as central for this country

name.description: The name of the country in english language

name_locale.description: The name of the country in the requested language

items.description: Here is a list of country code that have territorial border with the this country

population.description: The total population in this country

postalcode.description: The format of the postal codes if multiple format to be applied, then a pipe | is used as separator

postalcoderegex.description: The regex to use to check a postal code for this country

tld.description: The top level domain which is used by the local internet authority.

CountriesData.description: This is the data object for the response of a Countries API call

CountriesResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a Countries API call

distance.description: only in response when operating a lat/long search

data.description: Here is the distance between latlong A and latlong B, in the requested unit

DistanceResponse.description: This section provides response schema of pong response

ElevationResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a TimezoneRequest

PongResponse.description: This section provides response schema of pong response

dawn.description: Date and time of the dawn at local time of the given location

dusk.description: Date and time of the dusk at local time of the given location

goldenHour.description: Date and time of the golden hour at local time of the given location

goldenHourEnd.description: Date and time of the golden hour end at local time of the given location

nadir.description: Date and time of the nadir at local time of the given location

nauticalDawn.description: Date and time of the nautical dawn at local time of the given location

nauticalDusk.description: Date and time of the nautical dusk at local time of the given location

night.description: Date and time of the night at local time of the given location

nightEnd.description: Date and time of the night end at local time of the given location

solarNoon.description: Date and time of the solar moon at local time of the given location

sunrise.description: Date and time of the sunris at local time of the given location

sunriseEnd.description: Date and time of the sunrise end at local time of the given location

sunset.description: Date and time of the sunset at local time of the given location

sunsetStart.description: Date and time of the sunset start at local time of the given location

SunPositionData.description: This is the data object for the response of a SunPosition API call

SunPositionResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a SunPosition API call

TimezoneResponse.description: This is the main object for the response of a TimezoneRequest
